info.name: Somatosensory & Cerebellar inputs to thalamus
info.description: Somatosensory (medial lemniscal, spinothalamic & trigeminothalamic) inputs to thalamus as well as input from the cerebellum enter the posterior aspect of the thalamus.  The somatosensory inputs have transited the brainstem to reach this point and will terminate primarily in the ventral posterior nucleus of the thalamus.  The cerebellar inputs originate primarily in the dentate nuclei of the cerebellum, travel via the superior cerebellar peduncle into the midbrain where they continue rostrally into primarily the ventral lateral nucleus of the thalamus.
